title: Web Engineering - Lecture 07: Software as a Service(SaaS)

fill_in_the_blanks.question: ______ means using software over the internet instead of installing it on your computer.
Google Docs is given as an example of ______, where Google stores your work and keeps the software updated.
SaaS is also called web-based-software or ______ software.
A major advantage of SaaS is ______ updates, as the provider handles them automatically.
The ______ advantage of SaaS allows users to access services and features on-demand.
A disadvantage of SaaS is the dependence on internet ______.
A ______ application runs on remote servers located in data centers (the cloud).
In a cloud-based application, the core logic and data storage are handled ______.
Cloud-based web applications are typically paid for via a subscription or ______ model.
A ______ is a level of data storage that offers a specific balance of speed, capacity, and cost.
The ______ Tier is used for frequently accessed data and has a very high speed and cost.
The Hot Tier typically uses very high-speed SSD or ______ drives.
AWS S3 Standard-IA (Infrequent Access) is an example of a ______ Tier.
The ______ Tier is used for rarely accessed data like archives and old logs.
In the ______ Tier, retrieval of data may take hours.
A ______ is an organized collection of data stored and accessed electronically.
______ (Database Management System) is software used to manage databases, like MySQL or Oracle.
Databases support ______ operations, which stand for Create, Read, Update, Delete.
A ______ organizes and manages how data is stored and retrieved on storage devices (e.g., NTFS, ext4).
AI-Driven Layouts adapt for different devices, screen sizes, and user ______.

true_false.question: SaaS applications require the user to download, install, and maintain the software.
SaaS is usually offered on a one-time purchase basis.
SaaS applications cannot be accessed from any device with an internet connection.
One advantage of SaaS is 'Reduced time' because users can run apps directly from their browser.
SaaS offers unlimited customization and full control over data.
A cloud-based web application must be installed on a user's local computer.
Centralized management of cloud apps means the provider performs all updates and patches.
Cloud servers cannot scale resources; they have a fixed capacity.
Data is placed on storage tiers based on how often it needs to be accessed.
The Hot Tier is the lowest cost tier and has the slowest speed.
AWS S3 Standard is an example of a Hot Tier storage.
The Warm Tier is used for frequently accessed, real-time data.
The Cold Tier typically uses slow HDD or tape storage.
Retrieval from a Deep Archive Tier is almost instantaneous.
Storage tiering helps optimize performance versus cost.
A DBMS is hardware used to store data tables.
Databases can be relational (RDBMS) or non-relational (NoSQL).
File systems like NTFS and FAT32 provide a flat structure, not a hierarchical one.
Cloud storage integration enhances collaboration and data sharing.
Smart UI/UX tools like Adobe Sensei can analyze heatmaps, clicks, and scroll data.

mcqs.question: What does 'SaaS' stand for?
According to the lecture, what is the primary way a user accesses a SaaS application?
options: By installing it from a CD-ROM
Over the internet via a web browser
mcqs.answer: Over the internet via a web browser

mcqs.question: Who is responsible for updates and maintenance in a SaaS model?
options: The company that provides the software
A third-party contractor hired by the user
mcqs.answer: The company that provides the software

mcqs.question: Which application is used as an example of SaaS?
What is the typical payment model for SaaS?
What is another name for SaaS?
Which of the following is listed as an advantage of SaaS?
How does SaaS reduce time for the user?
options: By running faster than local apps
By not requiring downloads or installation
mcqs.answer: By not requiring downloads or installation

mcqs.question: Which of the following is listed as a disadvantage of SaaS?
Which of the following is NOT listed as a disadvantage of SaaS?
Where does a cloud-based web application run?
options: On remote servers in the cloud
mcqs.answer: On remote servers in the cloud

mcqs.question: Which of the following is a key characteristic of a cloud-based web application?
options: Updates are managed by the user
Universal access from any device with internet
Paid for with a large one-time purchase fee
mcqs.answer: Universal access from any device with internet

mcqs.question: What does 'Centralized Management' mean for cloud-based applications?
options: The provider performs all updates and maintenance
The application is stored in one central folder
The data is only accessible from one location
mcqs.answer: The provider performs all updates and maintenance

mcqs.question: What is a 'storage tier'?
options: A level of storage balancing speed, capacity, and cost
mcqs.answer: A level of storage balancing speed, capacity, and cost

mcqs.question: How is data typically placed on different storage tiers?
options: Based on how often it needs to be accessed
mcqs.answer: Based on how often it needs to be accessed

mcqs.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a common storage tier?
What are the characteristics of the 'Hot Tier'?
options: Rarely accessed, slow speed, low cost
Frequently accessed, very high speed, high cost
Occasionally accessed, moderate speed, medium cost
Long-term storage, very slow speed, very low cost
mcqs.answer: Frequently accessed, very high speed, high cost

mcqs.question: Which hardware is associated with the 'Hot Tier'?
AWS S3 Standard-IA (Infrequent Access) is an example of which tier?
What type of data is stored in the 'Cold Tier'?
AWS Glacier is an example of which storage tier?
Which storage tier is characterized by 'very slow' retrieval that may take hours?
AWS Glacier Deep Archive is an example of which tier?
What is the primary purpose of storage tiering?
options: To make all data access very fast
To eliminate the need for backups

mcqs.question: In the example use case, where are 'daily transactions' stored?
In the example use case, where are 'yearly summaries' archived?
What is a 'database'?
options: An organized collection of data stored electronically
A software application for word processing
mcqs.answer: An organized collection of data stored electronically

mcqs.question: What does 'DBMS' stand for?
What are 'records' and 'fields' in a database table?
What does 'CRUD' stand for in database operations?
Databases can be relational (RDBMS) or ______.
What language is used for data manipulation in relational databases?
Which of the following is NOT listed as an example of a database?
What is the function of a 'file system'?
options: To run applications in the cloud
To organize and manage how data is stored and retrieved on storage devices
mcqs.answer: To organize and manage how data is stored and retrieved on storage devices

mcqs.question: Which of the following is an example of a file system?
Which of the following is NOT a feature of a file system?
Where does 'cloud storage' store data?
options: On remote servers accessed via the internet
mcqs.answer: On remote servers accessed via the internet

mcqs.question: Which of the following is an example of cloud storage?
Which of the following is NOT listed as an example of cloud storage?
What do cloud storage platforms provide to integrate with databases and applications?
A key feature of cloud storage integration is that it reduces dependency on ______.
How does AI enhance web design, according to the overview?
options: By focusing only on server-side logic
By enhancing automation, creativity, and personalization
By replacing the need for HTML and CSS
mcqs.answer: By enhancing automation, creativity, and personalization

mcqs.question: AI helps designers create responsive, user-centered, and ______ websites.
How does AI in web design reduce manual effort?
options: By writing all the code from scratch
By analyzing user behavior and preferences
mcqs.answer: By analyzing user behavior and preferences

mcqs.question: What is the function of 'AI-Driven Layouts'?
options: To automatically generate page structures and layouts
mcqs.answer: To automatically generate page structures and layouts

mcqs.question: AI-Driven Layouts use ______ algorithms to optimize design elements.
Which of the following is listed as a tool for AI-Driven Layouts?
Which of the following is NOT listed as a tool for AI-Driven Layouts?
What is a benefit of AI-Driven Layouts?
options: Improves usability, accessibility, and conversion rates
mcqs.answer: Improves usability, accessibility, and conversion rates

mcqs.question: What do 'Smart UI/UX Tools' assist with?
options: Designing, testing, and improving user interfaces
mcqs.answer: Designing, testing, and improving user interfaces

mcqs.question: How do Smart UI/UX tools refine the user experience?
options: By analyzing heatmaps, clicks, and scroll data
mcqs.answer: By analyzing heatmaps, clicks, and scroll data

mcqs.question: Which of the following is a capability of Smart UI/UX tools?
options: To generate color palettes and typography suggestions
mcqs.answer: To generate color palettes and typography suggestions

mcqs.question: Smart UI/UX tools can provide A/B testing and ______ for better design decisions.
Which of the following is listed as an example of a Smart UI/UX Tool?
Which of the following is NOT listed as an example of a Smart UI/UX Tool?
What is 'Uizard' listed as an example of?
What is 'Framer AI' listed as an example of?
What is the primary advantage of the 'Hot Tier'?
What is the primary advantage of the 'Hot Tier'?
Which technology is used for data manipulation in RDBMS?
